organization.address: 110 Maryland Ave NE, Suite 108, Washington, DC 20002

translations.name: New Revised Standard Version
translations.description: New Revised Standard Version of the Bible (NRSV) is a 1989 update of the Revised Standard Version which was, itself, an update of the American Standard Version. The NRSV was intended to serve devotional, liturgical and scholarly needs of the broadest possible range of Christian denominations. The full translation includes the books of the standard Protestant canon as well as those traditionally associated with the Roman Catholicism and Orthodox canons.

translations.name: New Revised Standard Version, Catholic Interconfessional

publishedBibles.derived: Masoretic Text, Nestle-Aland Greek New Testament.

translations.name: Revised Standard Version
translations.description: The Revised Standard Version (RSV) is a revision of the American Standard Version (ASV) authorized in 1952 by the National Council of Churches. With its intent to \\\"preserve all that is best in the English Bible as it has been known and used through the centuries\\\" and \\\"to put the message of the Bible in simple, enduring words that are worthy to stand in the great Tyndale-King James tradition.” the RSV posed the first serious challenge to the popularity of the King James Version (KJV).

With its intent to \\\"preserve all that is best in the English Bible as it has been known and used through the centuries\\\" and \\\"to put the message of the Bible in simple, enduring words that are worthy to stand in the great Tyndale-King James tradition.” the RSV posed the first serious challenge to the popularity of the King James Version (KJV).

translations.name: Revised Standard Version Catholic Edition
translations.description: The Revised Standard Version is a full-scale revision to the RSV completed in 1989 by the National Council of Churches. It was the first major version to use gender-neutral language.

translations.name: National Council of the Churches of Christ
translations.description_short: The National Council of the Churches of Christ is the largest ecumenical body in the United States.

bibles.name: New Revised Standard Version, Catholic Interconfessional
